What is the purpose of the `setidentitytrust` command in Verus?

The `setidentitytrust` command is used to manage identity trust lists in a Verus wallet. It allows you to clear all trust lists, set ratings for specific IDs, remove ratings for IDs, and set the identity trust mode.

setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' Arguments {   "clearall": bool               (bool, optional) clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations   "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}  (obj, optional) replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given   "removeratings":["id",...]         (strarray, optional) erases ratings for IDs specified   "identitytrustmode": <n>           (number, optional) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Result: no return on success, else error Examples: > verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/setidentitytrust
What are the optional arguments for the `setidentitytrust` command?

The optional arguments for the `setidentitytrust` command are:

* `clearall`: a boolean value that clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations.
* `setratings`: an object that replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given.
* `removeratings`: an array of strings that erases ratings for IDs specified.
* `identitytrustmode`: a number that sets the identity trust mode, with possible values of 0 (no restriction on sync), 1 (only sync to IDs rated approved), or 2 (sync to all IDs but those on block list).

setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' Arguments {   "clearall": bool               (bool, optional) clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations   "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}  (obj, optional) replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given   "removeratings":["id",...]         (strarray, optional) erases ratings for IDs specified   "identitytrustmode": <n>           (number, optional) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Result: no return on success, else error Examples: > verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What is the purpose of the `clearall` argument in the `setidentitytrust` command?

The `clearall` argument is a boolean value that clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations. When set to `true`, it will remove all existing trust lists and ratings before applying the new settings.

setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' Arguments {   "clearall": bool               (bool, optional) clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations   "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}  (obj, optional) replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given   "removeratings":["id",...]         (strarray, optional) erases ratings for IDs specified   "identitytrustmode": <n>           (number, optional) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Result: no return on success, else error Examples: > verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How do you use the `setidentitytrust` command to set ratings for specific IDs?

To set ratings for specific IDs using the `setidentitytrust` command, you need to provide an object with the `setratings` key, where the value is another object with ID-rating pairs. For example:
```
verus setidentitytrust '{"setratings":{"ID1": JSONRatingObject, "ID2": JSONRatingObject,...}}'
```
Replace `ID1`, `ID2`, etc. with the actual IDs you want to set ratings for, and `JSONRatingObject` with the actual rating object for each ID.

setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' Arguments {   "clearall": bool               (bool, optional) clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations   "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}  (obj, optional) replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given   "removeratings":["id",...]         (strarray, optional) erases ratings for IDs specified   "identitytrustmode": <n>           (number, optional) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Result: no return on success, else error Examples: > verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How do you use the `setidentitytrust` command to remove ratings for specific IDs?

To remove ratings for specific IDs using the `setidentitytrust` command, you need to provide an array of strings with the `removeratings` key. For example:
```
verus setidentitytrust '{"removeratings":["ID1", "ID2",...]}'
```
Replace `ID1`, `ID2`, etc. with the actual IDs you want to remove ratings for.
